IP2025022_syn_1:
Indication: Recurrent left effusion.
Procedure: Medical Thoracoscopy.
Findings: 1.5L fluid, parietal nodules.
Action: Biopsies taken. Talc slurry pleurodesis.
Plan: Admit, chest tube.
IP2025022_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsy and pleurodesis.
FINDINGS: Thoracoscopic inspection of the left hemithorax revealed diffuse nodularity and studding of the parietal pleura, highly suspicious for malignancy. Approximately 1.5 L of straw-colored effusion was evacuated. 
INTERVENTION: Multiple targeted parietal pleural biopsies were obtained. Following complete drainage, a talc slurry was instilled to achieve pleurodesis.
IP2025022_syn_3:
CPT 32609: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with pleurodesis, including pleural biopsies.
Details: Visualization of pleural space, drainage of 1.5L fluid, biopsies of parietal nodules, and instillation of talc agent for pleurodesis.
Guidance: Ultrasound used for access.

IP2025022:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies and talc pleurodesis for malignant pleural effusion.
Patient: [REDACTED], 76-year-old male with recurrent left pleural effusion and suspected malignancy.
Anesthesia: Monitored anesthesia care with local anesthesia and moderate sedation.
Procedure details: Under ultrasound guidance, left 6th intercostal space in midaxillary line selected. 1.5 L of straw-colored fluid drained. Semi-rigid thoracoscope introduced; diffuse parietal pleural nodularity and studding observed. Multiple parietal pleural biopsies taken. Talc slurry pleurodesis performed after complete drainage.
Complications: None.
Disposition: Admitted overnight for pain control and chest tube management.
